intro: Mollinedia casca, commonly known as the Casca plant, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in humid, tropical environments and thrives in well-drained soil. The plant is also noted for its medicinal properties, with various parts used in traditional remedies.
